datafield.subfield: Lozano Dry Goods Co., 3101 M Street NW, Fire Court Case
This collection appears to have been donated by Mrs. Howard (Hannah) Cayton, 3069 Canal Street, NW, during the tenure of Peabody Room “curator” Mathilde Williams (1950-1978).

On December 24, 1897 a fire destroyed the Lozano Dry Goods Company, located at 3101 M Street, NW and 1208, 1210, 1212, and 1214 31st Street, NW. A subsequent lawsuit was filed by the company against six fire insurance companies* to recover various dollar amounts of insurance granted by the companies for the loss of stock and fixtures.
*Albany Fire Insurance Company of New York, $2,000 Citizens’ Insurance Company of Pennsylvania, $2,000 German Alliance Insurance Company and the German American Insurance Company of New York, $2,500 Hartford Fire Insurance Company of Connecticut, $2,500 Manchester Fire Assurance Company of England, $2,500 Western Insurance Company of Pennsylvania, $2,500
No documentation is included in this collection that reveals the result of the lawsuit.
